Bio: Baek Jong-won, sometimes spelled Paik Jong-won, is a South Korean chef. He is the main host of the SBS' cooking television series Baek Jong-won's Top 3 Chef King, Baek Jong-won's Food Truck, and Baek Jong-won's Alley Restaurant.

Recipes.name: Bibimbap
Recipes.instructions: 1. Season beef with salt and pepper and sauté in a pan until cooked through. 2. Blanch bean sprouts and spinach in boiling water and season with sesame oil and salt. 3. Sauté carrots and zucchini in a pan until tender and season with salt and pepper. 4. Fry an egg sunny-side up. 5. Place rice in a bowl and top with beef, vegetables, and egg. 6. Drizzle gochujang sauce over the top and mix well before eating.

Recipes.name: Japchae
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook sweet potato noodles in boiling water for 5 minutes, drain, and set aside. 2. Season beef with soy sauce and sugar and sauté in a pan until cooked through. 3. Sauté onion, carrot, and spinach in a pan until tender and season with sesame oil, salt, and pepper. 4. Combine noodles, beef, and vegetables in a large bowl and mix well. 5. Serve and enjoy!

Recipes.name: Kimchi Stew
Recipes.instructions: 1. Sauté pork belly in a pot until browned. 2. Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened. 3. Add kimchi, gochugaru, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and pepper and stir well. 4. Add enough water to cover the ingredients and bring to a boil. 5. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. 6. Serve and enjoy!

Bio: Roy Choi is a Korean-American chef who gained prominence as the creator of the gourmet Korean-Mexican taco truck Kogi. Choi is a chef who is celebrated for food that isn't fancy and is known as one of the founders of the gourmet food truck movement.He also maintains a blog on which he posts recipes and rants.He was addicted to crack for a short time, marijuana and gambling, which lasted three years in his early 20s. Choi says that his current addiction is feeding people.

Recipes.name: Bulgogi
Recipes.instructions: 1. In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, green onions, and black pepper. 2. Add the sliced beef and toss to coat. 3. Cover the bowl and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. 4. Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat. 5. Add the marinated beef and cook, stirring constantly, until browned and cooked through. 6. Serve hot, garnished with toasted sesame seeds.

Recipes.name: Japchae
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook sweet potato noodles in boiling water for 5 minutes, drain, and set aside. 2. Season beef with soy sauce and sugar and sauté in a pan until cooked through. 3. Sauté onion, garlic, carrot, and spinach in a pan until tender and season with sesame oil, salt, and pepper. 4. Combine noodles, beef, and vegetables in a large bowl and mix well. 5. Serve and enjoy!

Recipes.name: Kimchi Fried Rice
Recipes.instructions: 1. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat. 2. Add the bacon and cook until crispy. 3. Add the garlic and green onions and sauté for 1 minute. 4. Add the kimchi and sauté for 2-3 minutes. 5. Add the cooked rice and stir well to combine. 6. Push the rice to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the other side. 7. Scramble the eggs until cooked, then mix with the rice.

Bio: Kim Eun-ji is a Korean chef who specializes in traditional Korean dishes with a modern twist. She has worked in various high-end restaurants in Korea and has gained a reputation for her unique flavor combinations and artistic plating techniques.

Recipes.name: Haemul Pajeon (Seafood Scallion Pancake)
Recipes.instructions: 1. In a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, rice flour, egg, water, and salt. 2. Add the seafood and scallions and mix well. 3. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add enough vegetable oil to coat the bottom. 4. Pour the batter into the skillet and cook until the bottom is golden brown, about 3-4 minutes. 5. Flip the pancake and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. 6. Serve hot, cut into pieces.

Recipes.name: Bibimbap
Recipes.instructions: 1. In a large skillet, heat some vegetable oil over medium heat and cook the ground beef until browned. 2. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. 3. Add the carrot, spinach, bean sprouts, and shiitake mushrooms and sauté until tender. 4. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, and gochujang sauce. 5. Add the cooked rice to the skillet and mix well. 6. Pour the sauce over the rice and mix well.

Recipes.name: Japchae (Stir-Fried Glass Noodles)
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook the sweet potato glass noodles according to the package instructions. 2. In a large bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and garlic. 3. Add the sliced beef to the bowl and stir well to coat with the marinade. 4. Let the beef marinate for at least 30 minutes. 5. In a large skillet or wok, heat some vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 6. Add the marinated beef to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until browned.

Bio: Choi Young-jae is a seasoned Korean chef who has spent years mastering the art of Korean cuisine. He has traveled extensively throughout Korea to learn about the different regional styles and techniques, and he incorporates this knowledge into his dishes to create unique and flavorful meals.

Recipes.name: Bibimbap
Recipes.instructions: 1. Divide the cooked rice among four bowls. 2. In a large skillet, heat the sesame oil over medium-high heat. 3. Add the beef and garlic and cook until the beef is browned. 4. Add the soy sauce and stir well. 5. Add the spinach, bean sprouts, carrots, and zucchini to the skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes. 6. Divide the beef and vegetable mixture among the four bowls of rice.

Recipes.name: Japchae (Stir-Fried Glass Noodles)
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions and set aside. 2. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 3. Add the beef and garlic and cook until the beef is browned. 4. Add the onions and mushrooms and sauté for 2-3 minutes. 5. Add the spinach, carrots, and scallions and sauté for another 2-3 minutes. 6. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil.

Recipes.name: Jjajangmyeon (Black Bean Noodles)
ingredients: 1 package of fresh or dried noodles
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions and set aside. 2. In a large wok or skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 3. Add the pork belly and cook until browned. 4. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until translucent. 5. In a small bowl, mix together the black bean paste, sugar, cornstarch, and water. 6. Add the black bean paste mixture to the skillet and stir well.

Bio: Park So-yeon is a talented Korean chef who has a passion for creating traditional Korean dishes with a modern twist. She loves to experiment with different flavors and ingredients to create unique and delicious dishes that showcase the diversity of Korean cuisine.

Recipes.name: Kimchi Fried Rice
Recipes.instructions: 1. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 2. Add the bacon and cook until it is crispy. 3. Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes. 4. Add the chopped kimchi and sauté for another 2-3 minutes. 5. Add the cooked rice to the skillet and stir well to combine with the other ingredients. 6. Add the soy sauce, gochujang sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper to the skillet and stir well to combine.

Recipes.name: Dak Galbi (Spicy Stir-Fried Chicken)
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
Recipes.instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix together the gochujang sauce, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and vegetable oil. 2. Add the chicken to the bowl and stir well to coat with the marinade. 3. Let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes. 4. In a large skillet or wok, heat some vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 5. Add the chicken and marinade to the skillet and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes or until the chicken is browned. 6. Add the sweet potato, cabbage, scallions, and onion to the skillet and stir-fry for another 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

Recipes.name: Japchae (Stir-Fried Glass Noodles)
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook the sweet potato glass noodles according to the package instructions. 2. In a large bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and garlic. 3. Add the sliced beef to the bowl and stir well to coat with the marinade. 4. Let the beef marinate for at least 30 minutes. 5. In a large skillet or wok, heat some vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 6. Add the marinated beef to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until browned.

Bio: Lee Hyun-woo is a highly skilled Korean chef with a passion for creating traditional Korean dishes that are both flavorful and healthy. He believes that Korean cuisine is a true reflection of the country's rich culture and history, and strives to introduce the world to the many delicious flavors and ingredients of Korea.

Recipes.name: Japchae (Stir-Fried Glass Noodles)
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook the sweet potato glass noodles according to the package instructions. 2. In a large bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and garlic. 3. Add the sliced beef to the bowl and stir well to coat with the marinade. 4. Let the beef marinate for at least 30 minutes. 5. In a large skillet or wok, heat some vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 6. Add the marinated beef to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until browned.

Recipes.name: Haemul Pajeon (Seafood Green Onion Pancake)
Recipes.instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, water, egg, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, salt, and pepper to make a batter. 2. Add the squid, shrimp, and green onion to the bowl and stir well to coat with the batter. 3. Heat some vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 4. Add the batter and seafood mixture to the skillet and spread it out into an even layer. 5. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until the pancake is golden brown and crispy. 6. Slice into wedges and serve hot.

Recipes.name: Jjajangmyeon (Black Bean Noodles)
ingredients: 1 package of fresh or dried noodles
Recipes.instructions: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions and set aside. 2. In a large wok or skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. 3. Add the pork belly and cook until browned. 4. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until translucent. 5. In a small bowl, mix together the black bean paste, sugar, cornstarch, and water. 6. Add the black bean paste mixture to the skillet and stir well. 7. Cook for about 5-7 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. 8. Serve the noodles in a bowl and pour the black bean sauce over them.
